title: How to Use an Aztec Clay Mask

methods.name: Using an Aztec Clay Face Mask

steps.headline: Mix together equal parts Aztec clay and apple cider vinegar.
steps.description: In a medium-sized bowl, mix equal parts of Aztec Clay and apple cider vinegar. The acidity of the vinegar will help to soften and exfoliate skin while the clay removes oil. If you don't like the small of apple cider vinegar, use an equal amount of water to make the mixture instead. Aztec clay is available online or in beauty supply stores. For a more luxurious face mask, add one tablespoon (0.75 oz.) of honey to the mixture. EXPERT TIP																															Alicia Ramos																Licensed Medical Aesthetician								Alicia Ramos is a licensed aesthetician and the owner of Smoothe Denver in Denver, Colorado. She received her license at the School of Botanical & Medical Aesthetics, with training in lashes, dermaplaning, waxing, microdermabrasion, and chemical peels, and now provides skin care solutions to hundreds of clients. Alicia Ramos			Licensed Medical Aesthetician				Did You Know? Clay masks work by absorbing oils and liquids out of your skin as they dry. This clears your pores and can help lead to a healthier, more balanced skin tone!

steps.headline: Apply the mixture to your face for 15 to 20 minutes.
steps.description: Use your fingers or a clean cloth to apply the clay mixture to your face. Apply a layer that is between 1/8 and 1/4 an inch (approximately 0.5 cm) thick. Be careful to avoid getting the mixture in your eyes.

steps.headline: Let the mask dry.
steps.description: If you have normal skin, allow the mask to dry for between fifteen and twenty minutes. If you have sensitive skin, let the mask dry on your skin for only five minutes. Watch the time carefully or set an alarm to mark the exact time. As the mask dries, you will feel a tightening sensation on your skin.

steps.headline: Wash the mask off gently.
steps.description: Splash a small amount of warm water onto your face and rub it in circular motions to re-wet the mask. Once the mask is moist again, rinse it off without soap or facial cleanser. Take your time to avoid scrubbing or irritating your skin while removing the mask.

steps.headline: Dry and moisturize your skin.
steps.description: Dab your face dry with a clean towel. Let your skin rest for a few minutes, or until any redness goes away. Apply a light moisturizer to your skin.

steps.headline: Use the mask no more than once a week.
steps.description: Overuse of bentonite clay on the skin can be drying or cause irritation. Use an Aztec clay face mask no more than once a week. If you experience significant irritation when using the mask, avoid future use.

methods.name: Applying an Aztec Clay Hair Mask

steps.headline: Mix together Aztec clay, warm water, and oil.
steps.description: In a medium-sized bowl, combine equal parts of Aztec clay and warm water. For every tablespoon (0.75 oz.) of this mixture, add 2/3 of a tablespoon (0.5 oz.) of either grape seed oil or sweet almond oil. Mix the ingredients together thoroughly.

steps.headline: Apply the mixture to clean, towel-dried hair.
steps.description: After shampooing your hair, towel dry it. Apply a generous amount of the mixture to your hair strand by strand. Be sure that your hair is entirely covered.

steps.headline: Let your hair sit for about an hour.
steps.description: After applying the mask to all of your hair, let it dry for between 45 minutes and an hour. A tightening sensation on your scalp is normal. Despite how drying the mask might feel, it will actually boost your hair's moisture.

steps.headline: Rinse and condition your hair.
steps.description: Rinse your hair thoroughly with warm water. Be sure to remove all of the clay from your hair and scalp. Apply a rich conditioner to your hair. Rinse and dry your hair as usual.
